metadata.title: USN-3816-1 -- systemd vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Jann Horn discovered that unit_deserialize incorrectly handled status messages above a certain length. A local attacker could potentially exploit this via NotifyAccess to inject arbitrary state across re-execution and obtain root privileges. (CVE-2018-15686)  Jann Horn discovered a race condition in chown_one(). A local attacker could potentially exploit this by setting arbitrary permissions on certain files to obtain root privileges. This issue only affected Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10. (CVE-2018-15687)  It was discovered that systemd-tmpfiles mishandled symlinks in non-terminal path components. A local attacker could potentially exploit this by gaining ownership of certain files to obtain root privileges. This issue only affected Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. (CVE-2018-6954)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3816-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.8 systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.8 udev-udeb - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.8 systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libudev1-udeb - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libsystemd-dev - 229-4ubuntu21.8 systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libudev-dev - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.8 libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.8 systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.8 udev - 229-4ubuntu21.8 No subscription required
